questions.skill: Apply trigonometric ratios to find missing sides
questions.question: In a right triangle, one of the acute angles measures 30°. If the side opposite this angle has length 5, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.explanation: Using sin(30°) = opposite/hypotenuse: sin(30°) = 5/hypotenuse. Since sin(30°) = 1/2, we have 1/2 = 5/hypotenuse, so hypotenuse = 10.
